episodes.title: Religious Trauma Talk
episodes.description:
Rachel Thompson is the founder of #sexabusechat on Twitter. She an author and active leader in online mental health communities. Please check out her work at https://rachelintheoc.com 

Join in Rachel’s live mental health chats on Twitter every Tuesday at 11am PST / 2pm EST at https://Twitter.com/rachelintheoc

Follow Vennie Kocsis and explore her books and set at https://VennieKocsis.com/links

episodes.title: Reese Frederickson
episodes.description: Reese Frederickson prosecuted and convicted pedophile and cult leader, Victor Bernard. At  Move Forward's 2018 Cult Awareness Conference, Reese shared the story of the journey through evidence gathering, extradition and prosecution.

episodes.title: The Jane Tapes
episodes.description:
**ALL IMAGES AND FOOTAGE ARE THE SOLE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY OF SURVIVOR VOICES SHOW CREATOR VENNIE KOCSIS.**

Sam Fife was a Baptist minister who used his sinister beliefs to build one of the largest and least talked about cults in the United States, with some compounds globally. 

In the late 70's, Sam enlisted the services of a young pastoral intern at Tulane Hospital's psychiatric division. The young pastor wrote a thesis in which he described taking the job in order to see if Tulane would eventually accept exorcism as a form of treatment for individuals with mental impairments.  It was this young doctor who sent Jane to Sam for this exorcism. 

Sam Fife led his followers to believe that Tulane itself had called on him, thereby solidifying the belief that he was indeed, a prophet of God.  Jane Miller went on to be one of the few female ministry in Sam Fife's cults, lived comfortably and seemingly benefited what a critically thinking individual might call a carefully crafted hoax.

episodes.title: Glori Stiner Williams: Move of God cult Survivor
episodes.description:
Glori Stiner Williams is the founder of Move Forward, a cause dedicated to educating the public and providing emotional support to the survivors of Sam Fife's Move of God cult. Having left the cult just a few years ago, Glori shares the details of the trauma she endured, her ultimate triumph and where her life is today. 

Guest: Glori Stiner Williams: http://facebook.com/MoveForwardInc

Hostess Vennie Kocsis: http://VennieKocsis.com

episodes.title: Lilia Tarawa: Daughter of Gloriavale
episodes.description:
Lilia Tarawa is the bestselling author of "Daughter of Gloriavale", speaker and holistic lifestyle coach. She was born into New Zealand's infamous religious cult, Gloriavale. She broke free at eighteen years old.

In the 'real world' Lilia drifted not really knowing who she was. Now she's found a calling to 'empower people to live meaningful, passionate lives that belong to them'. Her life experience compelled her to a career promoting human rights, welfare and personal empowerment.

'I became an author, speaker and coach because I wanted to grow. I wanted to find out what I was capable of, push my limits and help others do the same,' she explains, 'The life you dream about is possible, but you have to be brave and take action. You have to be willing to let go of disempowering beliefs and adopt new ways of thinking. You have to become a whole new person.' 

Lilia's version of ‘happy’ is dinner with friends, a good book, indie or alternative rock, concerts, sci-fi movies and art galleries. She loves a fridge full of organic food, yoga, travelling and outdoor adventure. 'It’s about living a life that makes me say, Wow, I’m lucky,' she smiles.

"I learned I can't run from my past anymore.  It's here with me." Lilia Tarawa

Order "Daughter of Gloriavale": http://amzn.to/2DRpYCR

Lilia's Official Website: http://www.liliatarawa.com/

Lilia on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/liliatarawa

Lilia on Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/liliatarawa

Lilia on TEDx Talks: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qS7mBbXxJYA

Hostess Vennie Kocsis: http://VennieKocsis.com

episodes.title: Part 1 - Karama Sadaka: The Childhood
episodes.description:
At the age of three, Karama Sadaka embarked on a childhood of being groomed to become a "witness" for the Jehovah's Witness church. In this riveting three part series, Karma unfolds the trauma of his childhood, his father's murder, the impact growing up as a Jehovah's Witness had on his life, his harrowing experience through the horror of Hurricane Katrina and his ultimate victory. 

Karama Sadaka's "Witness the Drama" on YouTube: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR4RbPbXfjCCLKyS0IXgdpQ/videos

Karama Sadaka on Facebook: 
https://www.facebook.com/karama.sadaka

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis
http://venniekocsis.com

episodes.title: Child Friendly Faith Organization
episodes.description:
The Child-Friendly Faith Project is a national, nonprofit 501(c)(3) public charity that seeks to end religious child maltreatment or RCM, which is defined as child abuse or neglect that is enabled by religious beliefs held by perpetrators, victims, or the surrounding community.

They fulfill their mission by raising awareness of Religious Child Maltreatment/RCM through educational programs that benefit the general public, survivors, faith communities, and professionals who work in the field of child protection.

Guest: Child Friendly Faith Organization: http://childfriendlyfaith.org

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis: http://venniekocsis.com 

Follow on Facebook: http://facebook.com/SurvivorVoicesShow
Follow on Twitter: @Survivor_Voices #SurvivorVoices

episodes.title: M Dolon Hickmon
episodes.description:
M Dolon Hickmon is a child abuse survivor, a writer and an anti-abuse activist. He married his wife in 2007, and they have one daughter together.  Mr. Hickmon dedicates his time and skills to advocating on behalf of mistreated children, often in cooperation with children’s rights groups and other advocates. His writing has been amplified on news websites including AlterNet, Salon, and via The Spiritual Abuse Survivor’s Blog Network, and his opinions have appeared in newspapers such as The Scotsman, The South Lake Press, The Post-Searchlight and the Atlanta Journal Constitution. Mr. Hickmon’s original research continues to be cited by many and  was included in a 2010 civil rights presentation to a committee of the US Congress. (see footnote 16.) His hobbies include pleasure reading, songwriting, and playing acoustic and electric guitar.

Guest: M Dolon Hickmon: 1324book.com

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis: http://venniekocsis.com

episodes.title: John Huddle
episodes.description:
After 16 years of being in a small religious cult located in Western NC, John Huddle decided to leave the abusive group. His book, Locked In, documents his journey and subsequent struggle to be free from the Word of Faith Fellowship (WOFF) and its practices.

Guest: John Huddle: https://http://religiouscultsinfo.com

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis: http://venniekocsis.com

episodes.title: Linda Martin
episodes.description:
Linda Martin grew up in a multi-generational, faith-healing cult.  She watched children be born and die slow suffering deaths; the parents never charged, allowed in Idaho to utilize a freedom of religious defense. She left the cult in 2013, and now she is speaking out.  

Guest: Linda Martin: https://www.facebook.com/groups/silentvictims

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis: http://venniekocsis.com

episodes.title: Matt Pappas
episodes.description:
Surviving My Past exists to validate and encourage all who have survived the trauma of abuse. Matt Pappas is a survivor of Childhood Sexual Abuse, Narcissistic Abuse, and Bullying. He is a certified trauma support person and blogs to tell his story of living with Dissociation, Anxiety, and PTSD, shared openly in writing, podcasts, and videos.

Guest: Matt Pappas: https://www.survivingmypast.net

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis: http://venniekocsis.com

episodes.title: CULT CHILD author Vennie Kocsis
episodes.description:
CULT CHILD author  Vennie Kocsis joins Jim Harold to discuss her abused childhood growing up in Sam Fife's Move of God cult.

Jim Harold is one of America's most popular podcast hosts. His free podcasts can be explored at JimHarold.com.

Visit Vennie at her website: 

VennieKocsis.com
